attributes.action: Allow Alcoholics Anonymous meetings to continue as an exception to 'Rule of Six'
attributes.additional_details: AA and NA meetings are a critical part of a recovering addict's daily lifestyle and without which many could revert to alcohol or substance misuse. They need their meetings to be an exception to the 'rule of six' legislation announced on the 9th July 2020 by the Prime Minister. The meetings are run by volunteers most of which are also recovering addicts. The prior limit of 30 people allow for positive and meaningful meetings which are beneficial to addicts and society as a whole
attributes.background: Add Alcoholics Anonymous and Narcotics Anonymous fellowship meetings to the exception list for 'Rule of Six'

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care
